üìè General Sizing Tips

Expert advice to help you find the perfect fit every time.

üìè

Measure Yourself

Always measure yourself rather than relying on your old size. Bodies change over time, and sizing can vary between brands.

üëñ

Consider the Fit

Think about how you want the garment to fit. Slim fit for tailored look, regular for comfort, oversized for casual style.

üîÑ

Check Return Policy

Our 30-day return policy means you can try items and return if they don't fit. Size exchanges are free and easy to arrange.

üí°

Read Reviews

Customer reviews often include sizing feedback. Look for comments about fit and compare them to your measurements.

üìû

Contact Support

Still unsure about sizing? Our customer service team is here to help. We'll guide you to the perfect size based on your measurements.

üì±

Mobile Shopping

How to Measure Yourself

üìè

Chest/Bust

Measure around the fullest part of your chest/bust, keeping the tape level.

  1. Stand straight with arms at sides
  2. Wrap tape around fullest part
  3. Keep tape level and snug
  4. Note measurement in centimeters
üîß

Waist

Measure around your natural waistline, typically the narrowest part of your torso.

  1. Find your natural waist
  2. Breathe normally
  3. Measure around the narrowest part
  4. Don't pull tape too tight
üìê

Hips

Measure around the fullest part of your hips, about 20cm below your waist.

  1. Stand with feet together
  2. Measure around fullest part of hips
  3. Keep tape level all the way around
  4. Include both hip bones
üìè

Foot Length

Measure from heel to longest toe while standing on a piece of paper.

  1. Place foot on paper
  2. Mark heel and longest toe
  3. Measure distance between marks
  4. Add 1-2cm for comfort in shoes
